lines.text:
[about Spider-Man]
What'd he look like?
Oh, eh, like... like a spider.
How many legs did he have?
Well, two of course, he's a man.
You just said he was a spider. Spider's have got lots of legs.

[watching a special news alert on TV]
This is a newspaper story, what are they doing with it?

[referring to the mayor]
Sir, would you like me to go and take a picture of him?
Never mind, never mind! We've got enough pictures of the mayor to wallpaper the building!
Where's the money, Monahan? Where's the 5.000 big ones?
There must have been somebody else in the car.
Wrong, Monahan. Wrong. He was a lone wolf. But a crazy lone wolf. Look at 'em. Driving right into a brick wall. Can you explain all this to me, please?
Where's the money?

[in hospital bed]
What money?
Who told you to rob that payroll?
I don't know.
Well, professor, you don't have very many answers.
I'm afraid you know more about this than I do.
Then we're both in trouble. Who's the big mastermind? Who's the screwball that put this idea in your head?
I... I don't know.
We're back to square one.
I don't even know when it was done.
And I was saving the easiest question till last...
Do you mean, the person you'd like to question is Spider-Man?
I do.
What do you want to talk to him about?
Maybe I wanna ask him where he buys his webs.
Congratulations, Captain. Those men whould have flown away if you hadn't called their bluf.
Well, to tell you the truth, eh, I had a little help. That character in the clown suit, eh, he worked out pretty good.
That freak! He ought to be locked up. Running around like a one-man army. I don't know where he came from, but I sure hope he goes back there.
Maybe you're right. People shouldn't interfere with the law. Let the police do that.
Exactly. You men deserve all the credit for this job.
Well, if that's the way you're gonna put it in your paper, how can I stop ya?
[they laugh and pat each other on the back]
